page.title: 12FULLERTON GRANGE
page.content: FULLERTON FARM BELONGS TO MAJOR LIDDELL AND HIS SON JAMES AT COTTONWORTH. 1000 ACRES GROW WHEAT, BARLEY AND SUGAR BEET. THERE IS A HERD OF FRIESIAN CATTLE.ONLY 850 ACRES ARE USABLE. THE FARMHOUSE IS 300 YEARS OLD OF BRICK AND TILE, A LISTED BUILDING.IT HAS A GARDEN, ONCE THE FARMYARD,WALLED WITH A THATCHED COB WALL. THERE ARE GEESE, DUCKS AND HENS IN THE GARDEN AND HERBS ARE GROWN.THERE IS A LISTED DOVECOTE ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE ROAD USED AS A STORE. THE STABLES BUILT IN 1900 FOR 15 CARTHORSES ARE USED FOR STORAGE. THE LARGEST BUILDING IS THE CORN-DRIER.THIS IS NEW AND TAKES 60%OF THE WATER FROM THE CROP BEFORE STORAGE POORER QUALITY SCREENINGS ARE USED TO FEED THE STOCK.
